page.title: 10CHESHIRE OAK - FURNITURE
page.content: The Cheshire Oak factory is in a converted cow shed in Burwardsley which is rented from the Bolesworth Estate. The two partners wanted to start making furniture.They began the business in March 1985. At the moment they are making house furniture and garden furniture and for Christmas they are going to make toys. The woods they use are oak and mahogany and in the shed are stacks of wood and machinery.There is no smoking allowed because there would be a risk of a fire starting. My mum said, "I love the wood and making things out of it." As for the future they said that people wanted quality furniture and they could sell their furniture at home and abroad. The shavings are too hard for animal bedding, so far they have not found a use for them. Simon.
